messageBody:
> J. B. Rainsberger said:
> Abstract Test Case with an implementation for each particular fixture.
> Exclude the abstract test case from your test runner (however you run
> your tests).
>
> abstract class OverlapTestCase extends TestCase {
> abstract Rectangle makeRectangleA();
> abstract Rectangle makeRectangleB();
>
> testCommonProperty1() {
> // Use makeRectangle*() to make rectangles
> // assertions...
> }
> ...
> }
>
> Get the idea?

Yup, but there's still too much repetitive typing --- I'm trying
to come up with an approach that completely eliminates it.

> "Chermside, Michael" wrote:
> Try public STATIC inner classes. No need to create the enclosing
> class.

> and Steven Taschuk wrote:
> How about making the nested class static? Then there's no need
> for an instance of the outer class.

Yup, that works --- thanks very much.

Greg
